news_header: NASA astronauts and a Russian cosmonaut return from the ISS after seven months, delayed by Hurricane Milton.
news_text: Three NASA astronauts, Matthew Dominick, Michael Barratt, and Jeanette Epps, along with Russian cosmonaut Alexander Grebenkin, returned to Earth from the International Space Station after a seven-month mission. Their return was postponed due to Hurricane Milton. Upon landing in the Gulf of Mexico, the crew underwent medical evaluations, with additional checks conducted at a local facility as a precaution. During their time on the ISS, they conducted numerous scientific experiments, including studies on stem cells and astronaut health. Two astronauts, Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore, will remain on the ISS until February next year.
